ausflora 0.0.2.9000
  • Reference

    Find taxonomic alignments for a list of names

    align_taxa.Rd

    This function uses APC & APNI to find taxonomic alignments for a list of names.

    align_taxa(
  original_name,
  output = NULL,
  fuzzy_matching = TRUE,
  max_distance_abs = 3,
  max_distance_rel = 0.2,
  ver = default_version()
)

    Arguments

    original_name

    A list of names to query for taxonomic alignments.

    output

    (optional) The name of the file to save the results to.

    fuzzy_matching

    An option to turn off fuzzy matching.

    max_distance_abs

    The absolute distance in substitution space.

    max_distance_rel

    The relative distance in substitution space.

    ver

    The version number for the flora resource.

    Value

    A tibble with columns: original_name, cleaned_name, aligned_name, source, known, and checked.

    See also

    default_version for the default value of the ver parameter.

    Examples

    align_taxa(c("Poa annua", "Abies alba"), output = "taxa_alignments.csv")
#> Checking alignments of 2 taxa
#>   -> 0 names already matched; 0 names checked but without a match; 2 taxa yet to be checked
#>   -> checking for exact matches for 2 species
#> loading object `taxonomic_resources` into global environment
#> Warning: downloaded length 0 != reported length 9
#> Warning: cannot open URL 'https://github.com/traitecoevo/ausflora/releases/download/0.0.1.9000/apc.parquet': HTTP status was '404 Not Found'
#> Error in download.file(paste0("https://github.com/traitecoevo/ausflora/releases/download/",     version, "/apc.parquet"), destfile = tmp_pqt): cannot open URL 'https://github.com/traitecoevo/ausflora/releases/download/0.0.1.9000/apc.parquet'
